evidence.justification: Foundational infrastructure PRD establishing new protocol components justified by failure modes FM-0001 through FM-0005. Net-new abstractions required to address cryptographic admission, OCAP containment, and projection-only forge architecture.

angles.assessment: All requirements are technically feasible. Ed25519 signatures, OCAP containment, and projection-based architecture are well-understood technologies. Performance targets for watchdog polling (30s) and budget limits are reasonable. No CAP theorem violations or impossible performance targets detected.

Customer segments are well-defined with specific holon assignments (CUST-0001 through CUST-0006). Problem statement clearly articulates observable failure modes (FM-0001 through FM-0005). Goals directly address each failure mode with measurable outcomes. North star vision is clear and aligned with holonic laws.

Comprehensive risk analysis with 13 identified risks and documented mitigations. 10 open questions with resolution plans. Tradeoff analysis cluster STRICTNESS_VS_ADOPTION with Pareto configurations and coordinated rollout phases. One MINOR implicit dependency on self-hosted runners identified.

PRD explicitly imports requirements from PRD-0004 (Work Substrate) and PRD-0007 (Context-as-Code). Solution leverages existing kernel primitives (ledger, CAS, holonic execution). Net-new abstractions (GateLease, MergeReceipt, typed GateReceipt payloads) are justified by failure mode analysis showing existing components cannot address the threat model.

All 16 requirements have explicit acceptance criteria with verification methods. 32 evidence artifacts with concrete test commands. All evidence artifacts declare network_access and have deterministic capture paths. Acceptance criteria are measurable (e.g., 'emit ToolDecided=DENY with rule_id CTX-ALLOWLIST-001').

Graduated rollout plan with 4 phases (WARN -> SOFT_FAIL -> HARD_FAIL -> PRODUCTION). Divergence detection with freeze/unfreeze path. Emergency override ceremony documented. Defect taxonomy with 25+ codes for observability. Circuit breaker and retry policies defined.

Exceptional security design. Default-deny throughout (OCAP firewall, fail-closed CI import, egress deny). Ed25519 signatures with domain separation. Conflict of interest enforcement. Ambient credential prohibition. Trust zone separation (ZONE-REVENUE). 11 security controls documented with types (preventative/detective/corrective).

No contradictions detected. Requirements are internally consistent. Phase 1/2/3 scope is clearly delineated. Constraints and invariants align with requirements. Goals trace to failure modes. 16 decisions documented with alternatives considered and rejection rationale.

Exceptional tradeoff documentation. STRICTNESS_VS_ADOPTION cluster with criteria ranking (Security 0.45, Velocity 0.30, Observability 0.15, Reversibility 0.10). Pareto configurations evaluated. Quantified thresholds (e.g., <=15% context miss rate). Acceleration clause for data-driven rollout. No naive optimizations detected.

Feedback loops addressed. Echo-trap detection prevents reasoning degeneration (threshold=3, window=single GateRun). Bounded retries with exponential backoff. Circuit breaker with TTL. Refinement loop for context misses is bounded. Divergence watchdog prevents split-brain. No unstable feedback loops detected.

findings.description: Q-FAC-0004 identifies that obtaining stable runner image digests from hosted CI may require self-hosted runners, but no explicit dependency on self-hosted runner infrastructure is declared in stakeholder_entities. This is properly acknowledged as an open question with resolution plan.
findings.remediation: No remediation required - the open question mechanism appropriately captures this uncertainty. Consider documenting self-hosted runner requirement as a Phase 1 infrastructure dependency in stakeholder_entities, or accept L0 attestation for hosted runners with explicit policy documentation as outlined in RSK-FAC-0004 mitigations.

verdict_reason: All 7 gates passed with HIGH confidence. All 10 content review angles executed (8 required + 2 optional). 1 MINOR finding (implicit dependency on self-hosted runners appropriately captured as open question Q-FAC-0004 with resolution plan and mitigations in RSK-FAC-0004). Zero BLOCKER or MAJOR findings. PRD-0009 demonstrates exceptional rigor: complete traceability chain from 6 customer segments through 5 failure modes to 20 goals to 16 requirements to 32 evidence artifacts; explicit law alignment with 9 laws; comprehensive security posture with 11 security controls; quantified tradeoff analysis with Pareto configurations; graduated rollout plan; and strong verifiability with all acceptance criteria machine-testable.
recommendations: Proceed to RFC conversion and implementation planning
Address MINOR finding by documenting self-hosted runner dependency in Phase 1 infrastructure or finalizing L0 attestation policy for hosted runners
Consider ADR for Q-FAC-0001 (proto placement) before RFC authoring
Ensure Phase 2 metrics (MET-0010 through MET-0022) have baseline establishment plans
